p: The northern Albertine Rift borders with South Sudan and covers western Uganda, northeastern DRC, and Rwanda. It is one of the most biodiverse regions of Africa and comprises large water bodies and un-fenced natural areas, composed by a mosaic of grasslands, woodland savanna, and dense tropical forests [ 36]. This natural heritage value is recognized by several protected areas that are transboundary and compose the Greater Virunga Landscape, including QENP, Mgahinga Gorilla National Park (MGNP), and Virunga National Park. The Albertine Rift is also an area with relatively large and dense human populations of mainly sedentary agro-pastoral systems [ 37]. Further characteristics of natural and livestock systems in study areas are provided by country as Supplementary Material.
